shortdesc.ph: Creates an audio and video recording object.

section.p: Before starting audio/video stream recording, you need to call this method to create an audio/video recording object. The SDK supports recording multiple audio/video streams from local or remote users. You can call this method multiple times to create recording objects, and specify the channel name and user ID to record via the info parameter. After successful creation, you need to call to register an observer for the recording object to listen for related callbacks, and then call to start recording.

Before starting audio/video stream recording, you need to call this method to create an audio/video recording object. The SDK supports recording multiple audio/video streams from local or remote users. You can call this method multiple times to create recording objects and specify the channel name and user ID of the stream to be recorded via the info parameter. After successful creation, you need to call to register an observer for the recording object to listen to related callbacks, and then call to start recording.

Before starting audio and video stream recording, you need to call this method to create a media recorder object. The SDK supports recording multiple audio and video streams from local or remote users. You can call this method multiple times to create recorder objects and specify the channel name and user ID to be recorded using the info parameter. After successful creation, you need to call to register an observer for the recorder to listen for recording-related callbacks, and then call to begin recording.

Before starting audio and video stream recording, you need to call this method to create a recording object. The SDK supports recording multiple audio and video streams from local or remote users. You can call this method multiple times to create recording objects, and use the info parameter to specify the channel name and user ID to record. After successfully creating the object, you need to call to register the observer for the recording object to listen for related callbacks, and then call to start recording.
